website_summaries.verdict: Good price for a double lifting suction cup, but it doesn't have the load capacity of some others.
pros: Gives you a maximum load of up to 200 pounds
Considering its price point, it'll give you a nice level of performance, but it's not made for huge jobs
Measures 13.1 by 5 by 3.3 inches, which means you'll have a great size handle to hold comfortably and securely
cons: Struggles to fit tight on porous surfaces

customer_reviews.title: LOW QUALITY. It broke into two pieces yesterday when ...
customer_reviews.text: LOW QUALITY. It broke into two pieces yesterday when we were lifting a glass aquarium that is about 80lbs. The fist tank dropped on my foot and I'm in severe pain. If you go cheap on suction cups then you may have to spend on replacing the broken glass or granite stone. It is dangerous product. My fish tank is bottom up without the bottom glass as the tempered glass broke into million pieces. see photos. I lost $1000. My loss that no one will compensate.
customer_reviews.author: HONEST_&_True_Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend this product. It doesn't hold very well. It has too much play in the design. I bought a different brand for $4 more and it was significantly better then this HOD brand. I would not buy this again. The suction cup already started tearing after just a few uses. Cheap plastic design. it might work if you are going to set and forget it. But if you are going to keep using it, it won't last more then a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product!! We moved to a new home, and had to move an very large and irreplaceable antique mirror, off of the top of the fireplace mantle. Then we had to hang it back up, about four feet off the floor, and onto the wall of the new house. It took four people to do the very fragile move. After greatly researching these type of items, I went this this one, and it stuck on to the mirror without coming loose. Most Excellent Product!!
customer_reviews.author: Lonestar 38

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with a large pane of glass
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my attempt to reseal fogged sliding doors. After separating and cleaning the two panes of glass, it was time to reseal them. I ran a bead of silicone along the spacer, then had to lay a 3x7 sheet of glass onto it with total precision. After a disastrous effort to lower the glass by hand, resulting in badly smeared silicone, I realized I needed a suction handle to have any shot at making it work. These gripped the glass very well, making it easy to lower slowly and carefully. I'm really pleased with how well they worked, and I can foresee lots of other projects where they'll be useful.
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: I work for a window manufacturer so we use similar products to this at work. These are nice, but they are hard to trust. They don't seem to hold the suction as well as I would like to be able to trust them lifting expensive windows. I bought them to help me remove the sash from my windows so I could finish them, but quit using them because I couldn't trust them. I recommend getting the kind you have pump with your thumb, those also usually have a visual indication of if the suction is holding which these do not. I wouldn't recommend lifting anything over 20 lbs with one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Diah in the Doah

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money..honestly
customer_reviews.text: Suction is super weak. Seems built well but it will not stay at all especially a year after ownership. Get the metal version, it’s wayyyyy better and about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Evan D

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I needed to pull the glass off my 27" iMac (2011) and the kit by OWC had terrible little suction cups. So I got these and they did the trick. But they CAN fall off if you don't do it right, so be careful and hold the bottom of glass if that's what you are using it for. I don't know about carrying heavy stuff. Depends on how clean and flat the surface is. I didn't feel that this was infallible. Just that it got the job done, and I made sure to have a backup hand on the item being moved just-in-case.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis BarringtonTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: I removed and 2 -person carried a 4' x 7' x 5/16" wall mirror safely and confidently with these handles!
customer_reviews.text: I removed and 2 -person carried a 4' x 7' x 5/16" wall mirror safely and confidently with these handles! They are not pro-grade (pump type) for a glass / glazier, but frankly, I'm not a pro.. I'm a homeowner with a few big pieces of mirror to remove and move safely. They seem quite sturdy, they stick well with common-sense cleaning and care. They're perfect for handling glass/mirrors around the house and even some smooth surface furniture/appliance moving. I like the idea that I could align them and use a rod/pipe between 2 of them too. I recommend them for occasional use around the house...
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Repairs Laminate Floor Gaps
customer_reviews.text: I used this to pull gaps in my laminate floor together. After shrinking, I had several large gaps between the boards. I tried wood fillers but it looked unsightly.To try and remove the pieces would be quite time consuming and not feasible because it would require removing many boards as the gaps were in the middle of the room. This worked perfectly. I fastened the FastCap Hod-Double Handle down on one side of the gap. I hit it several times with a rubber mallet towards the gap, and it closed the gap. Home Run!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: If you lift big glass, get these now!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to overstate how extremely FUNCTIONAL these are compared to round lifters I got from Home Depot at almost the same price. With this set of "handles," I could lift a stubborn patio door by myself and get it back on track. I bought four of them, hoping it would help me use assistants on really heavy or unbalanced lifts of glass (patio doors, large windows) -- and they work awesomely. With four people, two each side, you can control a very heavy glass patio door, even if people are different in height. It was totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Merrell Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Loses their suction/not consistent
customer_reviews.text: Used these to move a fish tank and they worked great for that (only needed to use them once). I do NOT trust them now that they have been used a few times on other things. Even with proper cleaning they sometimes slip out of place (I can't have a $400 aquarium slip and break!) these are cheap so you get what's you pay for. I wouldn't recommend if your looking to use these often but if you need a quick cheap one time use these will probably work.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Repaired Our Laminate Kitchen Flooring!
customer_reviews.text: Based on a recommendation I found through YouTube - we used this suction cup to actually help repair our flooring. After the first summer to winter weather change, our kitchen floor started showing some gaps between the laminate wood flooring. We found a few tutorials mentioning the use of a suction cup and a rubber mallet. This product was great and held tightly as we tapped the gaps shut without damaging the wood floor!
customer_reviews.author: M. Steimel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Safety Insurance
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 of these to remove wall mounted mirrors.I wiped the mirrors clean and wet the suction pads, set the cups and covered the exposed glass with packing tape and removed the 4ft X 5ft mirrors, 60 lbs +/-. See the YouTube videos.Left the pads over night and carried the mirrors to the trash the next day. I set the cups on a man made marble sink and counter over night. The suction did not hold. Cleaned sink and reset the cups and picked up the sink and carried it to the trash.
customer_reviews.author: nojob

customer_reviews.title: It works great on laminate flooring.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this after watching videos of people using it to close gaps in floating wood flooring. It worked wonderfully. No more gaps. The suction is really strong. We used a plastic putty knife to help release the suction pads when the tool was still stuck after raising the release handles. We have not used it to lift anything so I can't speak how well it does that.
customer_reviews.author: tweetydee

customer_reviews.title: Rubber destabilized
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while...I needed to use these to install windows in a car...but when I left them attached for a while the rubber destabilized and 1) on one wouldn't achieve suction anymore and 2) on the other actually bonded to the glass requiring it to be cut off and the adherent rubber to be scraped off. They're cheap enough though and worked for the needed amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: CamperD

customer_reviews.title: Great help with windows!
customer_reviews.text: We need to put storm glass into our screened porch windows and take it out in summer. We use this on the last two for the winter-I think it will be very helpful when we go to remove all the panes in spring. Almost like a third hand. And if you are moving flat sided, smooth finished furniture (MDF) you can use this as a handle. ( I'm not doing that, but you could.)
customer_reviews.author: Movie Maven

customer_reviews.title: writing titles is the hardest part of a review
customer_reviews.text: There are included directions that state to let the suction cups sit on the object for 10 minutes before moving something. Huh? That's a joke, right? I think whether or not you like this depends on what you are using it for. If you want to pull dents out of a car, then no. If you want to lift glass off of tables, then yes. If you want to move furniture, then it isn't as strong horizontally as vertically, so probably not.
customer_reviews.author: TitleWriter

customer_reviews.title: Great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I watched a video on YouTube on how to close gaps in laminate (Pergo/Pergo type floors). The person used this and a hammer. The suction really adheres to the flooring plank and gently tapping a piece a wood wedged against this moves it and closes the gap. Worked like a charm. Really glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Alternative Use For Correcting Gaps in Floating Wood Flooring
customer_reviews.text: I did not buy the HOD for its intended use - (as a handle). I needed to "kick individual sections of bamboo flooring" to correct gaps that had appeared between the "interlocked boards." I "suctioned this device to the boards I needed to move" and hammered it with a rubber mallet. At first I thought the suction wasn't sufficient, but it actually worked and moved the specific boards into place! I highly recommend it for this use. Check out YouTube. There are videos (not mine) showing how it is done.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Berlin

customer_reviews.title: Right tool for glass and mirror moving.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Makes clumsy handling super easy with glass tips and mirrors. I don't have to use them often but even after several years they grip well.
customer_reviews.author: peb

customer_reviews.title: Fixed our laminate flooring and saved us!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help bump snap in laminate flooring back together where they have separated in the middle of the room. Instead of having to rip up the entire floor, just secure this to the loose piece, lock it down, and use a rubber mallet to bump the piece back into place. Youtube it. Works awesome! Has already come in handy in at least 6 places.
customer_reviews.author: MMahone

customer_reviews.title: I would NOT recommend this for use on any large project because It ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to hold a 2' X 4' plexiglass panel in place while the epoxy set up. It really needs to have more suction pressure on the cups because any small tilting of the handle in either direction broke loose the suction cups from the project. I would NOT recommend this for use on any large project because It doesn't have enough suction to provide a strong hold.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have around
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to work on a shower door. This lever-type suction is not as good as the plunger type because you have to mate the surface correctly the first time, whereas the plunger type lets you increase the vacuum -- which is handy if there is any leakage. However, this lever-type is cheaper and good enough for occasional use. It is also handy to pick up furniture or objects with smooth surface. It creates an instant handle.
customer_reviews.author: aJayM

customer_reviews.title: It works great! One day
customer_reviews.text: I use this to drop 1/4 tempered 3'x3' into aluminum frames for home-made solar panels. It works great! One day, I stuck it to the bottom of a cabinet and my one year old hung onto it, he's about 28 pounds and that was on the bottom of a dirty wooden cabinet. This thing works wonders on any flat surface, but is of course only meant for glass.
customer_reviews.author: RHM

customer_reviews.title: We'll see, 1st one made wrong, 2nd one works
customer_reviews.text: I guess I can't complain too much for the price. 1st one I received one of the suction cups was made wrong and would not latch. Replacement item seems to be ok. Did a speed test with an HG10 mounted to both hood and door of my F150. Ran about 10 miles at speeds up to 50mph, worked great as a camera mount. Just be aware to always mount it where the suction pads are in line with the wind flow or else you get a ton of vibration.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use for moving a heavy glass panel. One of them worked great, and one of them was worthless. The one that did not work just would not hold suction on the glass panel. Unfortunately, when you are moving heavy glass......you need to be able to rely on the product. For this reason, I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: If you have a glass inlay table - buy this
customer_reviews.text: Only sorry that I didn't buy this sooner. The dining table we use most often has a bamboo inlay covered with a sheet of glass. So much stuff creeps, crumbles and spills into the gap between the glass and the wood frame. I bought two of these and my hubby and I easily lifted the glass off and put it back on after scrubbing the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is great for laminate flooring to fix gaps. It isn't designed for that but it works. After a while the end will break from hitting with hammer because it is just plastic. This sticks well to flat surfaces for picking things up that don't have a good handle, etc.
customer_reviews.author: HandyMan

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm experimenting on suction cups for a project. I won't return this but... It's plastic and feels kinda cheap. The cups seem to have a strong hold, but the rubber is really soft. The cups won't release with just flipping the levers, you have to touch the rubber disc to get to release. I had recently purchased the aluminum handled one for the same price. This one's light cause it's plastic, but The aluminum one is far superior in quality. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: mr. pickles

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy handle, great grip
customer_reviews.text: Awesome to have on hand....just because. I put this on a window and carefully pulled (like a chin up). I felt no give or movement, although I didn't use my full weight as I didn't want to break my window. I have complete confidence that this will do exactly what it says it will. If you need a handle somewhere, this is well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: ValerieW

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I needed to install a 7' x 6' insulated glass panel (weighs about 200 pounds), and using 2 of these, a fiend and i easily (or far more easily than with out them) carried the glass up 3 floors, and installed the window without a concern regarding the grip of the suction handle. It comes with caps to keep the rubber suction pads clean as well. The suction cups worked fine even when the glass was not perfectly clean.
customer_reviews.author: A. Choyna

customer_reviews.title: worth their weight in gold!
customer_reviews.text: These made an 11 window replacement project possible. 2 of these allowed us to replace 150 year old upstairs windows from the inside. Each window weighed about 150 lbs and had to be placed in a location that had no room to hold them from their sides. These firmly gripped the window and allowed us to pick them up and set in place without fail. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jackt

customer_reviews.title: caution!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these on every suface I could think of. Tried three different ones and none worked at all. Maybe I'm misunderstanding something but unless you have experience with these and know these are what you really want, I can't recomment them.
customer_reviews.author: deesnap

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for removing glass panes from large computer monitors.
customer_reviews.text: This is an invaluable tool for us in the computer workshop. It's ideal for removing large glass panes from iMac LCD screens. We also carry sets with us in our vehicles for on-site work. Be sure to keep the suction cup surfaces clean. They are "grippy" and attract dirt like nobody's business. That dirt has to be removed completely or the cups will fail and / or scratch the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Tourpilot

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I restore historic windows and find handling large, heavy pieces of glass (sometimes over 4' x 4' laminated glass) can be very difficult. If the glass is clean, this handle works very well, particularly when I have to lift it from the frame. If the glass is dirty, it may slip or release. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J. Kleier

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works when it wants not a good item in my option
customer_reviews.author: South

customer_reviews.title: great to remove the top of our Jeep wrangler
customer_reviews.text: I came up with an idea of using two of these one on each side of the back windows to remove the top of my 2013 Jeep wrangler and they worked great. my wife and I were able to lift the top very easily. We put one on each rear side windows and with one hand on the front of the top and it makes very easy to remove the top
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Ginesta

customer_reviews.title: This item was a great buy. We purchased it to help fix laminate ...
customer_reviews.text: This item was a great buy. We purchased it to help fix laminate flooring in a condo we were selling. The flooring moves with weather changes and it didn't show well, so we went on line and found a way to fix it. Attach the handle to the board that needs moving and use a mallet to pound it into place.
customer_reviews.author: skgurley

customer_reviews.title: Works good but!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use when cleaning and waxing the boat. They attach well to a dry surface and hold pretty good. However once in awhile they will release on one cup. They will not work on "curvy" surfaces with the slightest bend. The surface has to be pretty flat! However they do work and keep me close to the boat while cleaning it. So I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: It sucks...just like it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use as a temporary fix for a broken control mechanism on one of my car windows. I tried using strong tape and about a dozen other things to keep the window up until I can get it fixed. The tape kept melting in the heat and nothing else lasted more than a day or two until I stuck this on the window. It's been holding it up like a champion for over a month now. The suction is very strong and the levers make it easy to attach to the glass even though it is curved. High five (stars)!
customer_reviews.author: Ulises

customer_reviews.title: Heavy glass lifting made easy
customer_reviews.text: Great to lift large heavy glass! I have a HUGE coffee table with a 25-30 lb glass on top that I needed to lift to clean the inside of the table. Upon first use I was afraid it would drop the piece-but no way! It suctioned on so strong I was impressed! Make sure to take the caps off before use
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Work great for lifting heavy glass panels
customer_reviews.text: Can beat these suckers for the price. Work great for lifting heavy glass panels. The only thing I've noticed compare to the more expensive units is that it leaves residue on the window after being used. Pretty impressed for the quality and performance for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Slava

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for carrying large pieces of glass!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these suction cups to help move a large piece of glass. They held the glass very well and it was able to be transported in one piece. Unfortunately when I took one of the suction cups off it completely fell apart. The other one held up just fine. I'm hoping the the one that fell apart was just defective.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Brown

customer_reviews.title: See That they
customer_reviews.text: They won’t hold most of the time but they Worked
customer_reviews.author: Al b.

customer_reviews.title: Worked awesome, however no instructions
customer_reviews.text: Worked awesome, however no instructions. It comes with shoes to protect the cups. I didn't realize this, I did finally figure it out. I used this to remove large flat screen panels from televisions. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Santangelo

customer_reviews.title: Works great as long as you can get a good seal
customer_reviews.text: Works great as long as you can get a good seal. Easy and quick to use. Will twist off if you really try, but not with a straight pull. Unless the seal isn't good. Follow the recommendations and you should be good.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: it's useless because it will not hold suction
customer_reviews.text: The suction pads ripped within the first few times I used it on my laminate flooring. Once the pads rip, it's useless because it will not hold suction.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Webb

customer_reviews.title: rubber has a tendency to crack over time
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, however the rubber has a tendency to crack over time
customer_reviews.author: supersailorke

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two as a gift for lifting glass top patio ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two as a gift for lifting glass top patio table. It worked well but only briefly one suction cup kept losing suction. Only had to use it for that so not sure if surface was not clean or smooth enough. I ordered two for myself I did not have any problems carrying a glass top patio table.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: these actually have a pretty solid feel and the grip strength is good
customer_reviews.text: these actually have a pretty solid feel and the grip strength is good. However, i would not use them without a second hand for a safety. As long as the surface which you are using them on is completely clean. I had one of them slip off a few times, but luckily had a safety tied on. Really a good product for the money
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Very nifty tool for glass
customer_reviews.text: Used product to help open my iMac for cleaning. Very strong and had no problem. I can see many uses for this product. I am giving it a 4 star review because a week within buying, one of the compression levers' top platform cracked. (circular part at the top of the compression lever) I had to mend with a silicone epoxy. Works fine after I repaired it.
customer_reviews.author: TimG

customer_reviews.title: easy to use on floating boards
customer_reviews.text: Used this with mallet to fix floating boards in floor. It work good on boards with no cracks in it but was unable to grab the boards with cracks
customer_reviews.author: Susan C.

customer_reviews.title: FastCap Succeeds Again
customer_reviews.text: I've liked every FastCap product I've purchased. They are well priced, designed and work they are supposed to, often solving problems other products don't (see their flat measuring tapes for woodworkers). These suction cups are super strong and work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Bouldernow

customer_reviews.title: The right tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed. These worked great. I would have had a miserable time dealing with the huge piece of glass I was working with without this tool and I can see that these will come in handy for other projects I have planned.
customer_reviews.author: Av8tor

customer_reviews.title: just amazing how this well constructed suction cup does its job ...
customer_reviews.text: just amazing how this well constructed suction cup does its job well, it will lift anything that has a flat surface and of course you are able to, I bought it to take a mirror off the wall, I couldn't get to take it down safely without this tool, recommend it
customer_reviews.author: ELIUSA

customer_reviews.title: Cheap - didn't work at all - would not stick to any of the allowed surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Didn't stick to anything as advertised. Incredibly cheap and flimsy. They use better quality versions of this where I work to move giant freezers. This is definitely not like that. I wouldn't trust this to move something that weighed 5 ounces. Back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Shiva

customer_reviews.title: Good grip
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality. Comes with covers for the pads to keep them clean and to prevent deforming when stored. I used this to carry my windshield during installation. It provides a strong, long lasting hold. It stays on until released.
customer_reviews.author: Japers

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says. Used this along with ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says. Used this along with an 8-inch vacuum handle to lift a 72x60 double-pane, double strength, energy-efficient window glass unit and had zero trouble. Another employee asked me to order him one.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful and probably saved me at least once when I ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to hold and control the position of a car rear window I was replacing. Extremely useful and probably saved me at least once when I lost grip on the glass itself. Also useful for working on certain glass computer monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Kourt

customer_reviews.title: Very handy for laminate floors
customer_reviews.text: This is a really handy tool if you happen to have laminate floors. It works great to bring separated pieces back together. Just attach it to the piece you want to move, and then tap it into place with a mallet. It's well made and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Joe DTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: looses suction fast
customer_reviews.text: looses suction just after a minute or so, need to work quickly, if one needs to carry large pieces of glass, this might not be suitable
customer_reviews.author: craftsman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. It is on the way back to amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this tool. Attached it to glass over night. Had to remove it with a flat screwdriver because the extremely soft rubber was glued to the glass. Soft rubber complete deformed due to the suction. Useless. Bad, bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Gülle

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to move a few of our laminate ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to move a few of our laminate floor tiles back into place. It did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Nabia

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 2 weeks later.
customer_reviews.text: Stopper working. Also fell apart. I ordered three of these (two double and one single). Each one has failed within about 2 weeks. Major disappointment, WERE GREAT FIRST FEW TIMES, but THEN THEY JUST BOMBED and don't stick even to glass anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Suffering_Servant

customer_reviews.title: Best ever for removing corvette top
customer_reviews.text: These you can not do with out on removing the top to store your corvette top. I bought these and the rack that holds the top. They hold like glue.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne McNeal

customer_reviews.title: Was sent a used unit
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, however mine looked like it was used. It was scuffed up right out of the box. Not worth the hassle to return.
customer_reviews.author: dreamingat30fps

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I had to remove several mirrors from behind a book case. We figured we would have to tape them up and then break them. Instead I gave this a try and all of them came off without any broken glass. Just wiggle it around a bit and you will hear the dry wall rip off. I used Kevlar gloves just in case but this made the job much easier and safer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for sliding laminate flooring back into place along with ...
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for sliding laminate flooring back into place along with a soft mallet. Well made. Can take being "banged" on by the mallet.
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyBR

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to maneuver my old laminate flooring back into place. The suction is awesome and worked perfectly for what I needed. As an added bonus it has caps that go over the cups for storage! Saves the cups from getting dirty!
customer_reviews.author: ConBon65

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but in case you don't know for cabinet ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but in case you don't know for cabinet moving it only works on sides that have a finish (smooth lacquer/laminate) as it sucks in it. If you have a cabinet with unfinished sides it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: J-G

customer_reviews.title: Seems Ok
customer_reviews.text: Just plain simple lifter with very sticky cups that easily collect dust. Used it to seat laminate floors that had small gaps. Should have gotten the aluminum one which seems more durable over a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Laoblue

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to help tap our laminate flooring back into place after it started backing out and it is perfect for the job!
customer_reviews.author: Mom2three

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've never used the pro-type suction devices with the button pump etc, but for about ten bucks, this guy holds really well. I'd be afraid to trust my life to any of these devices including this one, but I couldn't budge it once attached. Tested on glass shower door, and granite counter tops.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Not for Big Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I was taking down a huge mirror in my bathroom. The suction on it was just ok. I ended up forgoing the use of the FastCap and just using a towel and a hammer to take it down piece by piece. This is not for any kind of big job.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Its good
customer_reviews.text: I had to work with it some to get it to work on a pane of glass. I wasn't dumb enough to just go right ahead and run with it without testing it out first to make sure it'd stick. Once I got it working right then it worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.TX

customer_reviews.title: Love them for my glass display case!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to lift the glass on my store displays to clean them. life saver and I wish my window cleaner told me about this trick years ago. get them if you need to lift glass from any display case!
customer_reviews.author: S. Bahhur

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: sometimes this is tempermental about adhereing to a surface, but it worked well for what I bought it to do. I have plate glass windows in my sunporch and always needed help changing them to the screens in springtime. The HOD-DOUBLE made the job easier and i could do it myself.
customer_reviews.author: DownEaster

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: This was overkill for the project I needed it for but worked satisfactorily. The suction cup covers could definitely fit better as they tend to fall off when you pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: D. Macler

customer_reviews.title: The other side had very weak suction on a nice, smooth
customer_reviews.text: To say that this thing could lift 200lbs is a ridiculous overstatement. Only one of the suction cups on mine was even capable of producing suction on the glass. The other side had very weak suction on a nice, smooth, flat surface. There are other alternatives on Amazon that are a much better bang for the buck if you need to lift anything over 20 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke so quickly, we hardly got a chance to ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke so quickly, we hardly got a chance to use it. It fell about 4 feet onto our wood deck, and part of the black plastic around one of the suction cups cracked, and there went the suction. Not very durabale.
customer_reviews.author: Coyo

customer_reviews.title: These work great. I needed to push a strip of flooring ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I needed to push a strip of flooring back into place. The suction worked well. I can use this on many other projects around the house. A great buy. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Utah Pete

customer_reviews.title: Cheesy plastic, questionable quality.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic junk. Might do the job for a home boy, but I wouldn't recommend for professionals. Low cost for understandable reason.
customer_reviews.author: R. Eifler

customer_reviews.title: Easy secure glass lifting.
customer_reviews.text: Easy firm application, used two handles to move the glass top on our dining table, no more pesky crumbs trapped under the edges to remind us of past meals.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Sweeper

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until... it broke. I made a "wake gate" for wake surfing on my boat. Broke where I drilled holes in the plastic. Not exactly it's intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wolsborn

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My wood floor separated, (floating floor), I didn't like the gap, I bought this locked it down, shifted the board....looks great, worked great. I was surprised at the amount of suction power this has.
customer_reviews.author: kjsk71

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, and holds tight.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed an ad-hoc handle for my sliding glass door. So I can't attest to it's lifting ability, but it sticks like glue to my door. I feel like the glass would shatter before the cups would pull off if I were to try and hank it off. Solid little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Product did not meet my needs for vinyl flooring
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to use the product to address gaps I had in vinyl flooring. The hope is that I could get enough suction on the floor, that I could the tap the handle with a mallet. I could never get enough suction to hold. It must have been the surface. I tried the suction cups on table, and it worked fine. So the issue was not so much the product, just what I was trying to use them for.
customer_reviews.author: DaveM_NH

customer_reviews.title: I planned to return it but then forgot about it think it will soon go brand new still in the box into the garbage because that's
customer_reviews.text: Worthless won't stay on any surface. I planned to return it but then forgot about it think it will soon go brand new still in the box into the garbage because that's what it is a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: RonI

customer_reviews.title: Grip like a gorilla!
customer_reviews.text: Have had a chance to use these a couple of times now. As long as the surface is non-porous they grip like a gorilla! Makes moving furniture much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Ladd

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap quality!
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk...dont waste your money. This POC lost suction and dropped the glass I was lifting. I was very lucky the glass didnt break and I threw all four of the suction handles away!
customer_reviews.author: Sowadason

customer_reviews.title: I carry 3 surfboards with a sup wheeler and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I carry 3 surfboards with a sup wheeler and I put this on the nose of the top board that all 3 are strapped together and walk all 3 down the beach with ease
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle On Demand HOD
customer_reviews.text: The handle I ordered was used to remove to out glass on my Imac 20 for repairs. It worked so well that I had to use a small straight bit screwdriver to break the suction on the glass after repairs were complete! What an awesome tool for just $10.95!
customer_reviews.author: Louis R. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Junk!! Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk , worked about 3 times on sticking to the floor and would not stick anymore no matter how clean the floor or suction cup were,plus one end of thing came apart
customer_reviews.author: Shelia Durham

customer_reviews.title: A great help
customer_reviews.text: Needed some TEMPORARY safety grab bars in the shower after some back surgery Two pair did the trick in our large shower Caution.... Use carefully and check before each use
customer_reviews.author: Jaroca2

customer_reviews.title: We have flooring at home that this has done wonders ...
customer_reviews.text: We have flooring at home that this has done wonders for with regards to the separation that you get between pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Lena Bryant

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic. I use it to lift the huge (6'x3') ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. I use it to lift the huge (6'x3') piece of glass off my dining table to clean the area underneath the frame. And I'm not a particularly strong female.
customer_reviews.author: jjajak

customer_reviews.title: Used to remove glass from an iMac
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was cheap and all I needed to do was remove the glass panel off of an iMac computer. The suction cups worked great for this application. Not sure how they would work with a larger, heavier glass or mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Zman

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Happy I bought this tool that can be ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to remove glass screen on Apple iMac for an upgrade. Worked great. Happy I bought this tool that can be used for other jobs, and cost less than some iMac specific items.
customer_reviews.author: Blademan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working with auto glass this is great. Makes it easy handling panels of glass in any situation
customer_reviews.author: Marty Lee

customer_reviews.title: Iron grip
customer_reviews.text: Betcha can't pull this sucker off: litterally. Had to move some furniture with nowhere to grip. Ever been in that jam? Well, this device is easy to attach, holds on like a hungry gator, and doesn't marr the finish. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: W. Croom

product_meta.title: FastCap HOD-DOUBLE Handle On Demand
product_meta.description:
Size:Pack of 1FastCap HOD-DOUBLE Handle On Demand

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Stop straining your back trying to lift heavy stuff, suck it up. With FastCap's HOD (Handle on Demand) single or double, just fasten the suction pads to any non-porous surface and move it, lift it, place it, transport it, you decide.
feature_bullets: Handle on demands do not work on raw wood
Item Package Dimension: 13.0" L x 4.0" W x 5.0" H
